reviews.text:
Been here for both brunch and dinner. Love the elevated takes on simple, European-style dishes.

My pork shoulder this evening came out purple and impossible to cut. The team happily refired it, delivering a dreamingly tender cut with a deep pink blush. Beautiful piece of meat in the end, and they even took it off our check. Thanks for being on top of it. Duck was beautiful too.

Can't wait to come back for another neighborhood meal.

Food was amazing!! The service was just as great, we indulged in the oysters, the duck, and of course the pancakes- all amazing- 10/ 10 recommend. We went for brunch and want to go back for dinner already.

Came in here last night. Practically crawled from the cold sidewalk into this warm, sweet bar. Ate 3 oysters that were perfect and fresh, with bread and butter on the side. Felt like a meal that couldâ€™ve come out of a Tolstoy novel. Iâ€™ll be returning for Lily, the bartender. Iâ€™ve never seen anyone stand behind a bar and look so wonderful.

I love Chez Ma Tante. It's my favorite restaurant in Greenpoint. The vibe is very casual, cozy, and romantic. I love coming here for a date night. The dim lights and the restaurant's aesthetic are very chic and quaint.

The food doesn't disappoint. We got the chicken pate for an appetizer, which didnâ€™t look appetizing, but it was pretty good. We also got the fries, which were hot and crispy. The menu is seasonal, but the pork shoulder must be their signature dish since I got the same thing years ago, which is my go-to meal here. My boyfriend got the duck. They were okay, kind of hard to chew, a bit tough, even though the flavor is there.

We didnâ€™t have enough room for dessert, but the last time I was here, I tried their olive chocolate cake. I 100% recommend it.

For drinks, I would choose their wine options. Iâ€™m not a big fan of their cocktails.

Nothing special. We had a reservation but were running about 10 minutes late. Tried calling the place at least four times, no one ever picked up. When we arrived, they had already given our table away. We were seated fairly quickly though, but the hostess had an attitude. Ok we are late 10 minutes but keep it professional instead of saying â€œwe are too busy to pick up the phoneâ€.

The food was mediocre at best. The pancakes were too heavy and nothing to be excited about. The chips and aioli were okay.

Our waitress was nice, though.

Overall overpriced and overhyped.
Loved the place. It's my first time here, but I'll definitely come back again. The food was superb!
Excellent bartender!

This was the best service I have ever had at ANY restaurant ever. The attention!! We ate here for dinner and the food was wonderful. The best was definitely the pork shoulder with lentils. Unbelievable flavors. Also just overall really nice atmosphere and our cocktails were amazing too. Such a good experience!

Chez Ma Tante hosted our small post wedding dinner and made it an utterly special occasion. Everything we ate was phenomenal (especially the chocolate cake!), the drinks were delicious, service was friendly and overall perfect. Couldnâ€™t recommend more.

What we ordered:

Charred red peppers (vegan) and chicken patÃ© for nibbles; stracciatella with tomatoes and a kohlrabi salad for salad; strip steak (amazing!!), roast chicken (amazing!!), charred cabbage + fries with garlic aioli for main, and falafel for the vegans.

Chocolate flourless cake for dessert (phenomenal).

We made a selection of two cocktails - French 75s and Mescalitas and wine for drinkers. Everything was great.
truly the most incredible pancakes I may have ever had. great fennel sausage as well

We all agreed that the pancakes were good for first bite, but afterwards it was just too heavy and oily from the butter. Maybe some people love it, but itâ€™s too much for me ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨

I did like the fries though..but overall the experience was quite hectic and we felt we were somewhat being rushed.
The most phenomenal dining experience in New York.
Delicious brunch. All the pork dishes were spectacular. Chill vibe with fantastic and sophisticated food.

Finally got here for one of their famous brunches and completely lived up to the hype. The food was outstanding, the sausage gravy and biscuits was pepper, creamy delicious with every bite. Honestly every plate that arrived on every table looked magazine quality.

The service and atmosphere were perfect for a group or table for two. Looking forward to coming back again and again

I can hear my arteries tighten, but I also see why people like the pancakes here. They're perfectly cooked, fluffy, and have a hint of lemon, just waaaaay too heavy on the butter for me, it's literally unstomachable

Nothing else really stands out, the fried green tomato was recommended by our server but very underwhelming, country pate has super chunky texture, chips were nice that's about it

âœ¨Pancake $18
âœ¨Country pate $15
âœ¨Fried green tomato $20
âœ¨Chips and aioli $11

$35USD(å«ç¨…+å°è²»)

é€™å®¶é¬†é¤…ç¶“å¸¸åœ¨å„å¤§åå–®è¢«åˆ—ç‚ºç´ç´„æœ€ä½³é¬†é¤…ä¹‹ä¸€ï¼Œå¯¦éš›ä¾†åƒæˆ‘å¤§æ¦‚èƒ½ç†è§£ç‚ºä»€éº¼æœ‰äººå–œæ­¡ï¼Œæ˜¯çœŸçš„å¾ˆé¦™ç…çš„é‡‘é»ƒç„¦è„†çš„é‚Šç·£è³£ç›¸ä¸€ç´šæ£’ï¼Œä½†æˆ‘å®Œå…¨ä¸æƒ³å†å›è¨ªï¼Œé¬†é¤…è£¡è‡´å‘½åŠ‘é‡çš„å¥¶æ²¹æ„Ÿè¦ºç›´æ¥å‹•è„ˆç¡¬åŒ–ï¼Œç‚¸ç•ªèŒ„é…¸çš„å¾ˆä¸æ­£å¸¸ï¼Œpateå®Œå…¨ä¸æ˜¯æ…•æ–¯è³ªåœ°ï¼Œå”¯ä¸€å…¨å ´å¥½è©•çš„åªæœ‰è–¯æ¢

IG: joannekyc
Just get the pancakes. Nothing else was nearly as good. Worth the wait

This cute French Brooklyn Cafe is a homey fun place for dinner or Brunch. The wine list is amazing serving so great natural wines. The menu is unique and delicious, with a twist of worldly cuisine mixed into a French inspired menu.

Iâ€™m so disappointed with this place ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜­ Normally, Iâ€™m a very easy person to please. Iâ€™m not the type of person who writes bad reviews at all, but in this case, Iâ€™d like to share my experience. Because I hate spend money with bad food.

After waiting 30 minutes, we finally got a table, excited to try the famous pancakes and a few other things. Besides the pancakes, we ordered bacon, eggs, and a quiche.

The pancakes were okay and worth trying, but they were missing something to complement them â€” like jelly or some fresh fruit â€” because they only came with butter and syrup, nothing new or extraordinary.

The eggs and bacon were extremely oily, and I couldnâ€™t eat everything. I only ate the eggs because I was very hungry and didnâ€™t want to look for another place to eat.

I really wanted to come here and give a good review, but unfortunately, that was not my experience.

Tappa da uno dei posti piÃ¹ iconici di Brooklyn per un brunch domenicale con il proposito di assaggiare i loro pluriacclamati pancake. Devo dire di essere rimasto in parte deluso dato che ho trovato il gusto dei pancakes alquanto salato e con un persistente sapore di lievito. Consigli comunque di provarli anche per avere un termine di paragone con altri famosi ristoranti di New York che servono pancake. Molto buone la shakshuka con uova in camicia. Seconda tazza di caffÃ¨ offerta dalla casa, non scontento dato che molti ristoranti fanno pagare per ogni refill. Ambiente piccolo e privo di aria condizionata. Servizio attento e rapidissimo (tempo di attesa di circa 3 minuti fra lâ€™ordinazione e la presentazione dei piatti). Prenotazione consigliata.

Honestly, I donâ€™t know how this place stays popular. We came with a reservation and high expectations on a Saturday, and everything was fine until we tasted the food. The menu is very basic, with nothing standing out aside from the pancakes - that was the main reason we decided to give this place a try. The pancakes looked amazing, but they were insanely greasy. I had a quarter piece and just couldnâ€™t eat more.

The fried green tomato was recommended by our waitress, but it was also underwhelming - definitely not worth $20 if you ask me. The waitress came to our table a few times to ask if she could clear plates, but eventually she just started taking away our utensils without saying anything. We were left with food on the table but nothing to eat it with.

I get that it was close to their midday closing time, but thereâ€™s definitely a better way to handle that if youâ€™re trying to move people along.
Happy hour at the bar - it will totally make you happy!
The menu is short so there werenâ€™t many to choose from. The food was average. Not sure why itâ€™s thought to be one of the better pancake places. Pancakes were so greasyâ€¦.

I wasnâ€™t going to give 5 stars because that egg sando was mid. But that anchovie laced Caesar salad and those crispy edges on those pancakes AND the amazing service all made it worth it! 30 minute wait for Sunday brunch which turned out to be 20 minutes or so, followed by the perfect outdoor seating was clutch. Shouts to the hostess with the dope vintage cowboy boats too!
Weâ€™ll be back for that pork shoulder for dinner.
Go here!

I Stumbled across this restaurant for dinner. I was just off the plane from Sydney Australia. The atmosphere was electric, there was a buzz in the air, and the cocktails and food did not disappoint. It didn't help that the wait staff were beautiful â€“ with an English accent. If you're in Brooklyn, do not hesitate to stop by for one of the best margaritas in town
Fabulous
Have been for brunch and dinner and both are great. If you go for brunch you must get the pancakes. For dinner, the chicken liver pate is delicious as is the falafel. Lovely outdoor seating.
Ily
Pancakes did not disappoint, prosciutto melons and quiche were really good too
Great all round :-))) XXXXX

What a pleasant brunch experience! Pancakes 10/10, of course. The quintessential pancake you think of when youâ€™re craving a hot cake! Buttery and crispy, oh so good. The fries? Unbelievable. With the RIGHT amount of aioli on the side (lots). The sleeper hit? The cantaloupe and prosciutto- WOW. Easily the freshest, juiciest, most perfectly sweet cantaloupe Iâ€™ve ever had paired with high quality prosciutto, a salty sweet match made in heaven. Run, donâ€™t walk!
I celebrated my birthday brunch here with a friend and it was so great. Loved the pancakes, loved the oysters and sides
Canâ€™t recommend the oysters enough, fresh and the vine grate on top was fantastic. Sadly the pancake left a lot to be desired, dry, kind of oily too. Just average.

Went here for dinner last night with my girlfriend and had a great time. Olivia was our server and made sure everything was taken care of. Our main course was a little behind so they gave us free desert (creme brÃ»lÃ©e and ice cream) as well as some tea and coffee. Def coming back for the pancakes
A local gem & wonderful experience and great food ! thank you

Ich hatte groÃŸe Erwartungen an unseren Abend bei Chez Ma Tante â€“ nicht zuletzt, weil es ein besonderer Anlass war: Ich hatte meine Eltern seit Ã¼ber einem Jahr nicht mehr gesehen und wollte ihnen mit einem schÃ¶nen Essen eine Freude machen. Leider wurde daraus ein durchweg enttÃ¤uschendes Erlebnis, bei dem vor allem das VerhÃ¤ltnis von Preis und Leistung absolut nicht stimmte.

Bereits die Ankunft verlief holprig. Obwohl ich die Reservation 1,5 Wochen im Voraus gemacht hatte und wir pÃ¼nktlich um 19:45 Uhr eintrafen, mussten wir bis 20:00 Uhr warten, da alle Tische noch besetzt waren. Auf der Website wird ausdrÃ¼cklich darauf hingewiesen, dass GÃ¤ste bei VerspÃ¤tung mit Mehrkosten rechnen mÃ¼ssen â€“ umgekehrt scheint dieser Anspruch jedoch nicht zu gelten. AuÃŸer einer dreimaligen Entschuldigung kam vom Personal keinerlei Entgegenkommen â€“ kein Aperitif, kein Amuse-Bouche, nicht einmal ein kleiner GruÃŸ aus der KÃ¼che als Zeichen des Bedauerns.

Die Vorspeisen waren solide, wenn auch nicht Ã¼berragend. Der Country PatÃ© war geschmacklich gut, wurde aber ohne Brot serviert - etwas ungewÃ¶hnlich. Die Oliven hingegen waren hervorragend und rÃ¼ckblickend leider das kulinarische Highlight des Abends.

Bei den Hauptspeisen lieÃŸ die KÃ¼che lange auf sich warten. Nach fast 30 Minuten wurde uns erneut versichert, dass das Essen "in fÃ¼nf Minuten" komme â€“ was es dann auch tat, allerdings mit weiteren EnttÃ¤uschungen. Die Forelle war geschmacklich super, kam aber nur lauwarm auf den Tisch. Das Steak war zwar gut gebraten, aber insgesamt sehr Ã¼bersichtlich portioniert. Das grÃ¶ÃŸte Ã„rgernis war jedoch das HÃ¤hnchen: Es bestand grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils aus Knochen und Knorpel, begleitet von drei traurigen Brokkolistangen und einer total wÃ¤ssrigen, ebenfalls lauwarmen Sauce. Eine derart lieblos wirkende PrÃ¤sentation und Zubereitung hÃ¤tte ich in einem Restaurant dieser Preisklasse nicht erwartet.

Einziger Lichtblick war der Wein, der wirklich gut war â€“ was aber den insgesamt enttÃ¤uschenden Abend nicht retten konnte. Bei einer Rechnung von knapp 300 Dollar fÃ¼r drei Personen war das Erlebnis den Preis in keiner Weise wert. Noch eine Entschuldigung mehr hÃ¤tte da auch nichts bewirkt.

Ich kann dieses Restaurant leider nicht empfehlen und wÃ¼rde definitiv nicht noch einmal hingehen.

Excellent food. The pancakes, gigante beans + mushroom ragu, and chicken liver patÃ© really stood out.
Mimosas are priced out of reasonable range at $17 per flute. It's not a cocktail.
We had to ask about some missing oysters and got a very curt "all the food you ordered is coming" in response. I guess either we were lied to by the server or the kitchen really intended to send oysters as dessert, which would be absurd.
Just be honest. Stuff gets forgotten. It happens and its understandable. Lying with a bad tone isn't.
Nice, bright room with big windows perfect for enjoying a daytime meal while enjoying Greenpoint.
Enjoyed the pancakes here. Service is slow for outside but inside is great.

Came for brunch because Iâ€™d heard about the pancakes and left  very disappointed. They were crispy on the outside but also really oily there. The only edible portion was the center and theyâ€™re made of cornmeal so it was akin to lightly flavored cornbread.
Also worst take on shakshuka Iâ€™ve ever encountered though the sourdough bread read that accompanied it was great. The cured salmon and crÃ¨me fraiche were tasty tho ruined with copious amounts of olive oil.
Would have been a horrible start to the day if their kombucha wasnâ€™t so good.
Food was very delicious, the staff were welcoming and friendly. We were seated quickly on a Sunday despite not having a reservation, would definitely come back again

Great food! Very fresh ingredients and interesting combination of flavours. We had the oysters which were super fresh and delicious, the fries and aioli (OK), apple and hazelnut salad (OK) and the trout (very good) and a lemon tart (very good!). Extensive wine menu if you get a bottle but quite limited by glass.

Good day all, it is getting slightly easier to snag a table at Chez, although normally I have to book a week or two in advance. I was fortunate to make a reservation only two days prior. The staff here are cordial, respectful and very convivial. Friendly to a fault. They balance the right amount of attentiveness and when to lay back. I am always (and still surprised) at how delicious the pancakes are. The hummus plate is a MUST! Iâ€™ve had the quiche previously (last year). A few of the breakfast sandwiches. Iâ€™ve been saving (hopefully) the best for lastâ€¦the biscuits and gravy. Every time I see it on a menu my fingers are ğŸ¤ crossed!! Hoping they meet my expectations!!! When I am asked by my friends, family and co-workers where they should try for brunch? In my top three, Chez is there. Iâ€™m not going to let my other gatekeeps be known here, suffice to say I always want to be a Chez, but if I canâ€™t grab a resy here, Iâ€™ll opt for the other two. For everyone else who wants to try Chez, get your 100 Yard Dash shoes on! On Your Markâ€¦ğŸƒğŸ»ğŸƒğŸ»â€â™€ï¸ğŸƒğŸ»â€â™‚ï¸

Easily one of the best and most delicious spots in Greenpoint, we always look forward to returning to Chez Ma Tante. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, the cocktails (especially the gin martinis) are wonderful and the spot radiates warmth. Look forward to our next visit.

Shakshuka had no taste
Biscuit was mid
Pancakes were nice
Service was nice
Why do I have to give my phone number/info as a walk in?

ã€ŒUpdate: June 29th 2029ã€ï¼šThe worst dining experience.

This was our favorite place to have brunch until this visit. We sit indoor under a speaker which was blasting whatever music it was playing. It was so loud that everyone in the restaurant had to yelled to each other and competed with the speakers to be able to let the other people to hear what one is saying. We kindly asked two waitresses to help lower the volume, but no, the volume got up and the whole place got louder. One of them asked us to sit outdoor next time so it wonâ€™t be this loudâ€¦ lol, what a great attitude; basically what she meant was â€œitâ€™s not our fault itâ€™s your fault.â€ So unfortunately, the only thing I can do is to leave a one star (it was five stars before) and Iâ€™m sure the restaurant wonâ€™t care either. However, if you love loud party in the morning and lunch, Iâ€™m sure you would love to be there.
.
.
The review from a few years ago:
here and found out this is quite a surprise with good food, friendly people and chill vibe. The pancake is exceptional! Must order!

There is nothing wrong with Chez Ma Tante but there is nothing truly exciting either. I didnâ€™t find it memorable. Did I have a fine experience? Yes. Am I looking forward to going back? No. The menu is pretty limited. I am a pescatarian and I found only one (expensive) choice as an entree. We shared an appetizer (French fries with aioli sauce) and two â€œsaladsâ€: stracciatella and felafal. Not exactly the most exciting choices. Ended the meal with a share slice of key lime pie that was so uninteresting that between the two of us we didnâ€™t even finish it. We had a bottle of  Sauvignon blanc plus two glasses. And we paid $100 EACH including tip.

I had a lovely evening because of the company but the restaurant in itself was just  a functional setting. Maybe more interesting for brunch?

Very overpriced with a limited brunch menu. Unless youâ€™re getting pancakes, thereâ€™s not a great menu of brunch staples. A slice of Quiche ($22), biscuits and gravy ($27), and the egg sandwich ($19) are only real options for a brunch. For that price I would expect each to come with a side salad at the very least. They donâ€™t even cook the eggs in the sandwich made to order. Itâ€™s a glorified egg & cheese mcmuffin with a steamed egg and brioche bun (that I doubt they even make on site). Sausage is another $5. If you wanted a fresh side salad, thereâ€™s not even the option. They only have a drenched caesar salad that would be a separate order.

There needs to be a better brunch menu and the place is so stingy. Iced tea & cold brew were served in a tiny glass filled with ice and they donâ€™t offer any refills.

We were looking forward to eating here, but it turned out to be a disappointment. Yes, the ingredients tasted fresh but thatâ€™s the least I expect at this price point. Portions are very small, the fries looked great but werenâ€™t crispy, and the aÃ¯oli tasted overly acidic yet missed garlic. We sat inside and it was extremely, extremely loud so much so that we couldnâ€™t have a proper conversation. This wasnâ€™t the vibe or quality meal we were expecting.

Wir waren schon einige Male in diesem schÃ¶nen Restaurant in Greenpoint.
Ob Brunch am Wochenende oder Dinner, es war jedesmal ausgezeichnet. Alle von uns verkÃ¶stigten Speisen waren gustatorisch sehr gut und von bester QualitÃ¤t. Der Service ist immer sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend.

I loved almost all of the food! The pork terrine was flavorful without being too salty. The oyster has good filling. For the entrees, everyone loved the pork shoulder! The dish I liked the least was the chocolate cake as it was too rich compared to the otherwise balanced meal.

Tucked away in Brooklyn, this small and diverse gem of a restaurant offers an unforgettable dining experience. The staff was incredibly warm and welcoming â€” we felt right at home the moment we walked in. Thanks to the rainy day, we lucked out with three seats at the bar without any wait â€” a true blessing in NYC!

We flew in for a long weekend, and this spot was at the top of our list, largely due to the buzz surrounding Chef Oscar Paz and his now-legendary pancakes and pig face recipe. Let me just say â€” it absolutely did not disappoint.

The pancakes transported me straight back to my childhood â€” warm memories of my grandmotherâ€™s kitchen came rushing back with every bite. I couldnâ€™t help but smile. The pancakes were cooked to perfection with a welcoming hint of lemon zest. The pig face  Exquisite and unlike anything Iâ€™ve ever tasted. Chef Oscar deserves a standing ovation for these dishes alone.

We also tried the homemade biscuit, which   made a jar of jam taste like a treasured family secret.

Between the food, service, and pricing â€” everything was top tier. Whether youâ€™re a visitor or a Brooklyn local, do your palate a favor and make Chez Ma Tante a priority, Youâ€™ll walk away planning your return.

í•˜ì§€ë§Œ ê²°ì œê°€ ë‘ ë²ˆ ë¼ì„œ í•­ì˜ ë©”ì¼ ì‘ì„± ì¤‘..

We came here for weekend brunch with a reservation and had a great experience. The service was friendly and the food came out quickly with little wait between dishes. The egg sandwich and the gigante beans with mushroom ragu were both solid, and the pancakes stood out. They were crispy on the outside, fluffy yet crumbly inside. They were a touch heavy on the butter, but still enjoyable. Overall, a satisfying brunch spot with efficient service and well-executed dishes.

I recently dined here solo. Service was good, they checked on me a few times though alone. The food wasnâ€™t timed right however, my sandwich came out right away but I waited about 15 min for my pancake to come out and I wanted to eat them together but I did not get to do that. The pancake was nice and crispy and buttery. I tasted a nutty or maybe fruity note to them, perhaps from the butter toasting during the cooking process. The egg sandwich with bacon was quite good and the caramelized onions made it quite rich. Iâ€™d go back to try the biscuit. I did not appreciate the lack of non alcoholic drink options, Iâ€™d have liked more juices or a few mocktails. Also heads up the tip percentages are based on price after tax and the suggested options are 20, 25, and 30 :(

Pancakes are worth the hype, but also donâ€™t sleep on the other options. We tried the quiche, which was the standout dish for me, and the biscuits & gravy. Restaurant was packed Sunday for brunch, so reservations are recommended (outdoor seating isnâ€™t fully covered during colder days, so pick wisely)

Sometimes I still dream about the pancakes here - just the right balance of soft fluffiness to golden crispiness, and lightly soaked in syrup and butter! Strong contender for best pancakes Iâ€™ve had in New York! Accompanying dishes are new American style with focus on ingredients. Gets busy during weekend brunch so reservations are best!
We came for the super hyped pancakes situation which was amazing. Overall great experience. Donâ€™t be fooled itâ€™s more food than you might think or realize.
I am not particularly fond of pancakes; however, this one was exceptional. I would highly recommend these pancakes.

Had a fantastic brunch here with my friend today. It's a casual yet polished, cozy restaurant. It was busy, but not too loud.  We had delicious cappuccinos, and split the pancakes, quiche and a salad.  The quiche was divine-- layers of egg, cheese, and potato with truffle throughout. The truffle wasn't overpowering and the combination was great, especially with the fresh simple salad.  The pancakes were fantastic as well.  Simple, fluffy and flavorful with amazing, crisp edges. I wish I could make them like this!

We each left, paying less than 40$, which felt like a steal in NY. We even checked the bill to make sure it was all there!

Can't wait to come back!

I love it here! Delicious food delicious vibe. I got the secret burger last week and it was one of the best burgers Iâ€™ve ever had.

Other menu recs:
Chicken liver pate
Chips and aioli
Kohlrabi salad
Fennel sausage (my favorite)
Squid

Also the pancakes are really the best in the city

Heard about their Pancakes , so we decided to take the ride from LI to Brooklyn . This Sunday Afternoon with no reservation , we had to wait about 30 mins for a bar table. Food was delicious  , I liked the biscuit and gravy . Pancakes were okay , I liked other things more. Definitely on the pricey side .

The best brunch spot in NYC. Everything is delicious, we always get the pancakes, chips with aioli and Caesar salad. The pancakes are so unique, they are crispy on the outside and somehow completely soaked through with syrup and butter. Also worth a stop for dinner where you can cap off a lovely meal with their beautiful lemon tart.
Absolutely delicious. The chips & aioli and the pancakes are my all-time favorites. We usually get a few plates to share and so far there hasnâ€™t been anything we havenâ€™t liked.

My partner and I have been to a lot of solid restaurantsâ€”this is without a doubt in our top three of all time. The pancakes are the best youâ€™ll ever have but donâ€™t let that stop you from exploring the rest of the menu because everything weâ€™ve tried is exceptional (the only thing thatâ€™s remotely mediocre is their black coffee). Absolutely make a reservation ahead for brunch unless you want to wait multiple hours. We go out of our way to visit every time weâ€™re in NY and it has not disappointed!

Theyâ€™re back! After being closed for 6 months Chez Me Tante is back and as good as ever. Beautiful wine, incredible food, amazing service. Iâ€™m always a little worried about a decrease in quality after place closes for a bit due to construction issues or whatever but Iâ€™m happy to report this place is still perfect. Get the skate ğŸ˜­ğŸ’–

Came here because they supposedly have the best pancakes in NYC, and I think they are indeed the best pancakes I've ever had. Slightly crispy on the outside and so fluffy on the inside, with a bit of a citrusy flavour. So nice to visit a place that lives up to its hype. Very friendly service too and a nice atmosphere.

We came for the pancakes, and the pancakes were delicious! Iâ€™m not a huge fan of pancakes, but my girlfriend loves them, thus I have been eating quite a lot of pancakes recently. These had an essence of lemon and were wonderfully fluffy, but the best feature was the crisp they held. That crisp made each bite my favorite bite. The syrup was quite good as well, wasnâ€™t overly sweet and had a slightly complex flavor which I appreciated, but the pancakes soak it all up quite quickly so you sort of need a lot of it. Overall, are they  very special? No, not really, but thatâ€™s kind of what makes them special. Itâ€™s like having the very best version possible of homemade pancakes available to you without any of the hassle of making them. They are the truest version of what pancakes are, no bells and whistles, no fancy compote or sugary toppings. This feature sets them aside from other restaurants, these pancakes donâ€™t need to try so hard because the fundamentals are so perfected.

We also enjoyed the quiche, which had a slightly thicker and well done crust than I would have preferred, but the flavor was bold and was a welcome palate reliever from the sweet pancakes. The side salad also notably paired beautifully with the quiche.

Overall a wonderful brunch :)

A gem of a place! Easy going fine dining appealing to your sophisticated palate without neglecting your appetite. Phenomenal side dishes, excellent entrees, and delectable drinks. The chicken liver pate is special and a mainstay while theâ€¦

Absolutely phenomenal food. I came for brunch and ordered the egg & sausage sandwich, chips & aioli, and pancakes. Everything was perfectly executed (thanks to a copious amount of butter in every dish). The garlic aioli was addicting, theâ€¦

the perfectly crispy pancakes on the outside with a fluffy interior. honey butter and syrup elevated the whole tasting experience to the next level. pair this sweet goodness with fresh strachiatella, topped with ripe tomatoes, basil, olive oil & salt on fresh sourdough and youâ€™re in love. what a fantastic brunch. only qualm is the small tables.

From the first bite, I knew these were going to be the best pancakes Iâ€™ve eaten. Nothing else comes close. The pancakes taste almost deep-fried, like those donuts with a sturdy shell, full of flavors from browning. Even though thereâ€™s no visible liquid on the plate, the pancakes feel saturated with butter and syrup, sweet but not too sweet. It was extremely rich and cloying. Yet, I wanted every last bit. Coffee helps.

Chez Ma Tante has been around for six years, so Iâ€™m late to the party, but this feels innovative and boundary-pushing without being gimmicky. I never would have imagined pancakes like these based on the ones Iâ€™ve eaten in the past. It takes knowledge and creativity to *invent* something like this. Hopefully this style of pancake fully takes off and appears across the globe.

I got pate and roast chicken. Pate was all right, it wasn't bad. Chicken was really good, crispy skin, juicy and flavorful...but kind of disappointed that it was just chicken and no sides for that price (29$). It would be great with broccoli and mash potatoes or something, but it's still good.  My waitress was Sabrina, she was professional, and I had great service. Thank you.

This was a genuine 5-star experience with all the freshness you could expect from a summer brunch. The restaurant's decor was bright and cozy with ambient sunlight peeking in. The food was light yet filling at the same time, with the pancakes having the perfect balance of crisp first-bites and satisfying fluffy flavor. The quiche was soft and easy to get into, each layer was distinct yet crafted a cohesive flavorful experience. The fresh juices were refreshing and the staff welcoming and friendly. Overall, could not have had a better start to the morning than with our brunch here. I will say the location is a bit far from the nearest subway station, but well worth the walk in every aspect.
Love this restaurant and have been back twice. The staff is amazing and everything on this menu is very good. I love the dorade and the burger you can order at the bar was life altering.
